Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Inadmissibility based on senior official status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the male applicant a prescribed senior official under s. 35(1)(b) of IRPA, and did the Officer breach the duty of fairness?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 35(1)(b)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Male applicant served as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Iraqi army (rank 6 of 17); Officer reviewed military hierarchy charts and consulted War Crimes Unit
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Officer’s decision was reasonable and transparent; no breach of procedural fairness
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Immigration Officer applied top-half indicator and considered unclassified documents
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over whether rank constituted 'senior official' under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness and procedural fairness under administrative law
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Position within military hierarchy (top half of organization)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged breach of duty of fairness during assessment
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants were interviewed and given opportunity to respond
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Military hierarchy charts, unclassified documents, interview responses
Crimes.Application_Basis: Rank and position in Iraqi military under Saddam Hussein's regime
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Hierarchical rank, organizational structure, role responsibilities
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Senior officials in regimes with human rights violations are inadmissible
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; sufficient evidence supported conclusion
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential denial of immigration benefits due to inadmissibility
Crimes.Cause_Description: Male Applicant's rank in Saddam Hussein's regime triggered inadmissibility concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence gathered through official consultation and interview process
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No significant issues identified with evidence collection or use
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – application stage, not established residency
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not applicable – inadmissibility based on status, not false statements
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction under Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably assessed rank using top-half indicator
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Lieutenant Colonel rank placed individual in senior tier of military hierarchy

Crimes.Crime_Name: Violation of human or international rights
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility due to association with regime committing human rights violations
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: IRPA s. 35(1)(b) and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s. 16(e)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Male applicant’s service as senior military official under Saddam Hussein’s regime
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law incorporating international human rights norms
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of seniority and regime involvement in human rights abuses
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Officer’s decision upheld as reasonable and fair
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / War Crimes Unit
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Unclassified documents, military hierarchy data, interview records
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Foreign national seeking entry/residence in Canada
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Military leadership role in state apparatus linked to human rights violations
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Military rank, service history, command responsibilities
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Top-half indicator of organizational hierarchy to determine seniority
Crimes.Governing_Body: Immigration Officer with input from War Crimes Unit
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Allegation of unfair process and incorrect classification as senior official
Crimes.Protected_Group: N/A – claimant is respondent in enforcement action
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Prescribed senior official in regime engaging in human rights violations
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Regime (Iraq under Saddam Hussein) deemed to engage in human rights violations
Crimes.Credibility: Applicants given opportunity to respond; credibility not directly challenged
Crimes.Targeted_Group: Civilians subjected to human rights violations by Iraqi regime
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Deemed inadequate due to systemic violations
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Command responsibility and structural complicity in abusive regime
Crimes.Perpetrator_Entity: Iraqi military under Saddam Hussein government
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Status-based inadmissibility for senior officials in abusive regimes
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Civilians in Iraq subjected to state-sponsored human rights abuses
